wordpressWpDailyReads.title: Daily Reads 8/14/2019
wordpressWpDailyReads.content:
Hi, everyone. Today we read about the yield curve and what it actually means for your money. WeWork reveals a massive $900 million loss in filing to go public. Learn some important strategies for planning your finances, not just for now but for the future. With vacation session coming to a close, many Americans take off some time to relax, but 40% say they won’t be vacationing due to the costs associated. And we learn from Wimbledon winner, Novak Djokovic, about his key tips for success, and how this can benefit you.

MARKETS

The inverted yield curve explained and what it means for your money

If you’ve been gleaning financial headlines, you may be asking, what is this “inversion of the yield curve” thing and why is it so scary?

 

BUSINESS

WeWork reveals massive $900 million loss in filing to go public

WeWork released its much-anticipated IPO prospectus on Wednesday, revealing a $900 million loss in six months as the workspace rental company lined up to join a flurry of tech companies going public in 2019.

 

PERSONAL FINANCE

Four essential documents that could save your financial life

Many people have no desire to talk about “what if” when it comes to their finances. That’s because they’re often too busy figuring out what to do with their money right now.

 

Americans Say They Can’t Afford a Vacation

More than 40% of Americans have opted out of a getaway over the past year specifically because of the cost, a new study finds.

 

PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT

Novak Djokovic: Meditation, Yoga and Veganism Helped Shape My Success

Even among elite athletes, Novak Djokovic is well-known for his devotion to eating clean. This might have something to do with the fact his initial rise to number one coincided with him going gluten-free, or that he’s both published a diet book and opened a vegan restaurant, Eqvita, in Monaco.
